comment.body: Welcome, @ulrichard!
@ulrichard: I believe images have been disabled for privacy reasons.

Am I the only one who see older and unrelated comments to this post?

@ulrichard, did you switch hub, or something?
Ah, I see. Thanks.
Perhaps ZeroMe should use UUIDs instead ‚Äì would that be possible (haven't looked at the code)?
That's a lot of hubs!

@<tkarita/>: Ironically, Erkan registered all those names to prevent squatters from squatting them. Unfortunately Erkan has been absent since May, or so. I may me able to contact him vial plain old email. However, he hasn't responded to zmail, bitmessage or tox messages. I'm unsure if I have his phone number. If I do, I can call him.
Please tell us more. Do you have a blog around here?
Erkan just sent me these few words in a private message on IRC: ¬ªThe outlook for now: I don't run Zeronet anymore.¬´

Today's word of wisdom from Beyond the Known is talking exactly about how you feel:

¬ªIt is not that we have forgotten compassion. We just spend all of our time wishing things were different from what they actually are.¬´
Interesting concept with the public folders. It reminds me of Keybase's public folders.
@ÁãóËõã: probably here: https://github.com/bashrc/freedombone
Yes
/me goes with PEP8

Which mesh are you talking about?
Theoretically an NTP server on hyperboria/cjdns should be able to broadcast time to fc00::/8's broadcast address. And I assume the same would hold for ZeroTier's ‚ÄúEarth‚Äù mesh.

That's right ‚Äì and it's scary. I found out that Google knows when I start which app, when my phone's screen is blanking (and unblanking). And that's on Cyanogenmod with a minimum (although obviously not minimal enough) of Google installed. üò±
I've always wondered how wifi-location works, do you know?
Ah, ¬ªThe Wi-Fi hotspot database gets filled by correlating mobile device GPS location data with Wi-Fi hotspot MAC addresses.¬´ ‚åò https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wi-Fi_positioning_system
Not quite the same, but there's [ZeroTodos](/1B8LmXYHzMGZzcRWoidAQb5SmKSyfjN63f/).

This year I did some urban gardening on my balcony: at the end of June I sowed 3 √ó 2 cherry tomato seeds (since the seed bag told me to expect a germination rate at around 50%). All 6 seeds germinated, and I couldn't bear to murder 3 of the seedlings so I let all plants grow ‚Äî somewhat crowded ‚Äî in the same large pot. I then discovered that this kind of cherry tomatoes were meant for growing in a greenhouse, and since the summer in Denmark was quite cold this year I expected to harvest only a few tomatoes and perhaps have another few ripen by picking them and letting them sit in the windowsill.
I was put to shame: I August we had 2-3 warm weeks and I have harvested at least 6 big handfuls of delicious cheery tomatoes. There are still a couple of handfuls left on the plants outside but they will have to ripen indoor as the temperatures are quite autumn'ish now.
It's been a good experience, so I'll probably grow tomatoes ‚Äî and possibly other vegetables ‚Äì again next year.
/me thought XRP were long dead‚Ä¶

@ulrichard: or someone could have dropped a big stash, we'll never know.
How's Stellar faring these days? As dead-looking as Ripple?
@ulrichard: neither do I and so did I. The only cryptocurrencies I use, besides Bitcoin, are Namecoin and NXT (the latter will become Ardor in a few days).

I enjoy reading Schneier for his expertise. He is very biased, though:

> We don't know who is doing this, but it feels like a large nation state. China or Russia would be my first guesses.

He should have included the US in that sentence.
@Lain: DYN is not the regime, and the regime might want to check just how easy it is to take out e.g. social media.
This really shouldn't be able to happen. Jeez!

Would it be helpful to look at the PKGBUILD scripts from ArchLinux AUR?

* https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/zeronet/
* https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/zeronet-git/
WTF, indeed!
What does the .js file do?
@ulrichard: sounds like a serious case of #uxfail to me!
@ulrichard: I agree.
It works very well. I just wish it was ArchLinux based rather than Ubuntu.
UK, Germany, Denmark‚Ä¶ Argh! üòí
@ulrichard: exactly!

IMHO, you should pick up domains only if you actually want to use them. Remember how Erkan Yƒ±lmaz snatched up a gazillion zero-related domainnames, then left Zeronet? Please don't make the same mistake. Take what you need and leave the rest for somebody else.

Did you really pay 10 NMC for the domain? That's a hundred or a thousand (or more) times the price you'd pay if you registered it on the blockchain itself:

Last year I bought 110 NMC. I have registered more than 30 domains and IDs on the blockchain and most of them have been renewed once. And I still have more than 109.35 NMC in my wallet.
@Kaffie: That's fine, I was just worried you'd been had.
@Kaffie: I'm aware of that. I've been discussion with myself for a long time whether I should submit a pull-request for ZeroName so that domain names are checked for validity.
@Kaffie: I beg to differ.

@Loligod: The Namecoin database is free-form: You can enter any string. d/something is used for domains, id/something is used for identities, and so on, but if you want, you can enter xyz/something and use it for you own purpose. That's fine and how it should be. Now, the d/ namespace has a certain specification (mentioned in a comment further down) on a ‚Äúplease use this format‚Äù basis, but namecoin ain't gonna check that people are doing it right. And that's fine and how it should be.
@Loligod: Well said
@Jop: mine, too (except I run my own searx instance).
